messages.message:
I’ve been getting these errors when I run the Instabase stack locally:
```[2022-03-14 10:48:12,477] {/Users/hoangpaul/Documents/instabase/webserver/webapp/build/py/instabase/config_utils/hot_config.py:134} INFO - Filepath=/config/base-hot-config.yml does not exist
[2022-03-14 10:48:12,477] {/Users/hoangpaul/Documents/instabase/webserver/webapp/build/py/instabase/config_utils/hot_config.py:134} INFO - Filepath=/config/webapp-config.yml does not exist```
I can work around it by running the service’s own Docker containers, but has anyone else encountered this issue and addressed it?
Hey yes, when running locally this does show up. But it can be ignored. I will think of a fix so that this does now show up in the logs when run locally.

Strange. I’m getting 500 response from nginx when I visit the File Explorer (https://localhost/hoangpaul). But when I change `webapp` and `core-platform-service` from running locally to using Docker, I no longer get a 500.

Before I investigate further, can you confirm that visiting the File Explorer while running the stack locally is working for you @Sabyasachi Roy?

(note: weirdly enough, opening a Flow project works normally)
did you see any other errors logged by `webapp` when you ran it locally and went to the File Explorer? or just the error in your original message?
No errors besides `Filepath=/config/base-hot-config.yml does not exist` and `Filepath=/config/webapp-config.yml does not exist`
+1 to your question then, seems like the error can’t be ignored
I am pretty sure the 500 error will be unrelated to the error log you are seeing. Are you using provisioned.py to run thr services?
